summary: This is a formal U.S. Department of Justice request to French authorities for assistance in the prosecution of Ghislaine Maxwell. It seeks to interview a French citizen witness who was allegedly sexually abused by Jeffrey Epstein after meeting him and Maxwell, and to obtain records from French law enforcement and Epstein's Paris residence. The document outlines the charges against Maxwell and Epstein, and requests expedited, confidential cooperation.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The subject of the U.S. prosecution for her alleged role in assisting Jeffrey Epstein in the sexual exploitation and abuse of minor girls. She is charged with conspiracy, transportation of minors, coercion and enticement, and perjury.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Described as having engaged in the sexual abuse of minor girls from approximately 1994 through 2005. He was indicted in July 2019, arrested, and died by suicide in August 2019. His conduct is central to the charges against Maxwell.

connections.description: Maxwell is alleged to have conspired with, assisted, facilitated, and contributed to Epstein's sexual abuse of minors by recruiting, grooming, and enabling the abuse of victims.
The document states Maxwell invited the French witness to New York, where Epstein subsequently sexually abused her, implicating Maxwell in the process.
The French witness is understood to have been sexually abused by Epstein in New York after meeting him and Maxwell.

events.title: Alleged Conspiracy and Abuse Period
events.description: The period during which Maxwell is alleged to have conspired with Epstein to entice and cause minor victims to travel to New York to be groomed and subjected to sexual abuse by Epstein.

events.title: Epstein Indictment
events.description: A grand jury in the Southern District of New York returned an indictment charging Jeffrey Epstein with conspiracy to sexually traffic in minors and other crimes related to sexual abuse of minors.

events.title: Epstein Arrest
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was arrested pursuant to the indictment and detained pending trial in New York.

events.title: Epstein's Death
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein committed suicide in his jail cell in New York.

events.title: Search of Epstein's Paris Residence
events.description: French authorities searched Jeffrey Epstein's residence in the Paris 16th district, seizing materials including documents and photographs.

events.title: Maxwell Indictment
events.description: A grand jury in the Southern District of New York returned an indictment charging Ghislaine Maxwell with crimes related to her role in Epstein's sexual abuse of minors.

events.title: Maxwell Arrest
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell was arrested pursuant to the indictment and has been detained pending trial in New York since that date.

events.title: Scheduled Maxwell Trial Date
events.description: A trial date of July 12, 2020, had been set for United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell (mentioned as a past date in this January 2021 document).

locations: Southern District of New York (jurisdiction for prosecution)
New York (location of alleged abuse of French witness and where Epstein/Maxwell were detained)
Paris 16th district (location of Jeffrey Epstein's Parisian residence that was searched)
Maison-Laffitte, France (place of birth for Ghislaine Maxwell)
France (citizenship country of the witness and location of requested assistance)
keyFacts: The U.S. is seeking to interview a French citizen witness who was allegedly sexually abused by Jeffrey Epstein in New York after being introduced to him and Ghislaine Maxwell.

The request seeks French law enforcement records of prior interviews with this witness and materials seized from Epstein's Paris residence in September 2019, including photos and documents related to Maxwell.
The document states the investigation into Epstein's network continued after his death, leading to Maxwell's indictment for her role in recruiting, grooming, and facilitating the abuse of minors.
The U.S. authorities believe the French witness may be a critical witness and the subject of additional charges against Maxwell, prompting the expedited, confidential request.
The charges outlined against Maxwell include Conspiracy (18 U.S.C. ยง 371), Transportation of Minors (18 U.S.C. ยง 2423), Coercion and Enticement (18 U.S.C. ยง 2422), and Perjury (18 U.S.C. ยง 1623).
